speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me how often you experience nosebleeds and if there are any specific triggers that seem to cause them?

speaker: Patient
text: I get nosebleeds a lot, maybe a few times a week. Sometimes they just happen out of nowhere, but I think they might happen more when I’m playing outside or if I bump my nose.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any other symptoms, such as easy bruising, prolonged bleeding from cuts, or any unusual bleeding from your gums?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I’ve noticed that I get bruises really easily, and sometimes my gums bleed when I brush my teeth. It’s kind of scary when that happens.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent illnesses or infections, and do you have any family history of bleeding disorders or similar symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been sick recently, and I don't think anyone in my family has bleeding problems. My parents haven't mentioned anything like that.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your energy levels, such as feeling more tired than usual or having difficulty with physical activities?

speaker: Patient
text: I feel pretty much the same as always. I play with my friends at preschool and run around a lot, so I don't think I'm more tired than usual.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin, such as rashes or unusual spots, or any swelling in your joints?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't seen any rashes or unusual spots on my skin. My joints feel fine, and I can move them without any problems.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or medical procedures that could have affected your bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations or medical procedures. I'm up-to-date on all my shots, and I haven't been to the doctor for anything else lately.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your menstrual cycle, if applicable, or any unusual bleeding during bowel movements or urination?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have a menstrual cycle since I'm a boy, but I haven't noticed any unusual bleeding when I go to the bathroom. Everything seems normal there.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your diet or any new foods that you've tried?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really changed what I eat. I still have my usual foods like fruits, veggies, and snacks. No new foods that I can think of.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any blood tests done in the past, and if so, were there any abnormalities noted?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any blood tests before, so I don't know if there were any problems. My parents usually take me to the doctor for check-ups, but no tests yet.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of excessive bleeding after minor injuries, such as cuts or scrapes?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, sometimes I bleed a little longer than my friends when I get a cut or scrape. It makes me feel worried when that happens.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my weight or appetite. I still eat all my meals and snacks like I usually do.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any dental work done, and if so, did you experience any unusual bleeding during or after those procedures?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any dental work done yet, so I don't know if I would bleed a lot or not. I just go to the dentist for check-ups.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual symptoms like frequent infections or a tendency to get sick more often than your peers?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any frequent infections or gotten sick more than my friends. I usually feel healthy and play with them all the time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your nails, such as unusual shapes, colors, or brittleness?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed anything different about my nails. They look the same as always, and they don't feel brittle or anything like that.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual fatigue or weakness, especially after physical activities?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't felt any unusual fatigue or weakness after playing. I still have lots of energy to run around and play with my friends.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to medications, such as over-the-counter pain relievers or herbal supplements, that could affect your bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't taken any medications or supplements recently. I usually just have my regular food and drinks, nothing special.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any family members or close relatives who experienced similar bleeding issues or were diagnosed with any blood disorders?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think any of my family members have had bleeding issues. My parents haven't talked about anyone having problems like that.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your overall health, such as frequent headaches or any other unusual symptoms that might be concerning?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any headaches or anything else that feels weird. I feel pretty normal most of the time, just the nosebleeds and bruises.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any episodes of bleeding in other areas, such as your eyes or ears, or any unusual swelling in your face?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any bleeding in my eyes or ears, and my face looks normal. I haven't noticed any swelling either.

speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Von Willebrand Disease

speaker: Patient
text: What does that mean, Doctor? Am I going to be okay?
